text: I don't have this link on my interface (in French). What "Overriding default setting" do?
<@UC58HV0MB>
Hi:wave:, How can I get input field value and assign it to my variable? I want to achieve something like this: {% set tag_post = {{module.tag_field}} %}.... but this code gives me an error

the `{{` tells it to print the variable. You don’t need it when setting a variable.

`{% set tag_post = module.tag_field %}`
as long as your field is actually called tag_field this should work
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/intro-to-hubl>
thank you, let me test it
thanks

Hey <@UBF61JD2R>, we apologize for the inconvenience you’re experiencing with the new embed updates. We’re actively investigating the best way to approach scenarios like this to 1) help _you_ resolve your issue with the least amount of work needed on your end and 2) prevent this from impacting other customers down the road. I will get back to you shortly once we’ve reached a conclusion
You were specifically hooking into the `hs-responsive-embed` classname with more custom CSS, correct? Was there anything else going on?
I think that will override the default setting of header, footer, etc for different domains.

Putting this here for documentation purposes:

The functionality to be able to change the Site header HTML/Site footer HTML based on subdomain has always been available.

A user can go to the relevant settings page, click on the dropdown to choose a subdomain, and change the code in either section, to have it be unique/separate from the default code or code for other connected subdomains.

The option 'Override default settings' is actually a new feature not yet fully released. It's being implemented due to past confusion regarding how code specified for a subdomain, would override the default code.
I have yet to actually get this far in our startups lead gen journey, but I would assume you could just upload a csv file of leads after the event is over
For example, we have always been at shows with badge scanners and we then get a csv after the show is over
